boardgame.description: It is a dark time for the galaxy. The Galactic Empire has consolidated its dominion through the might of the Imperial Navy. In the underworld of the Empire's most populated planets, and in strongholds throughout the Outer Rim, powerful gangsters rule vast criminal organizations. From the shadows, those lost to the grip of the dark side of the Force scheme to bring their evil designs to bear on an already oppressed galaxy._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Yet not all hope is lost. The Rebel Alliance resists the iron grip of the Empire. Smugglers and other fringe elements lend their aid to the Rebellion. And unknown to the Emperor and his dark minions of the Sith, the last remnants of the noble Jedi Order work tirelessly to restore peace and order to the galaxy._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Star Wars: The Card Game is a two-player card game that puts one player in command of the Rebels (light side, with the factions Jedi, Rebel Alliance, and Smugglers And Spies), and one player in command of the Empire (dark side, with the factions Sith, Imperial Navy, and Scum And Villainy). The Balance of the Force expansion allows multi-player games. The game is set within the time-frame of the original Star Wars trilogy._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Each player has a deck of objective cards representing various missions plus a deck of player cards of units (characters, vehicles, droids and creatures), events, enhancements and fates. Each objective is linked to a set of five player cards. Deck construction consists of choosing which objectives are to go into your objective deck, then adding each of those objective's set of five player cards to your player deck. Game play consists of deploying cards to your tableau, attacking your opponent's objectives, defending your own objectives, and committing cards to the Force Struggle._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The Empire wins if the Death Star dial reaches 12, with this dial increasing by one on each dark side turn, effectively putting a timer on the game. It may also be increased by winning the Force struggle, destroying light side objectives, and via card effects. The Rebels win by destroying three dark side objectives before the Empire wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

For sale is a collection of Star Wars: The Card Game by Fantasy Flight Games. This listing includes all cards from the core set x2, Edge of Darkness deluxe expansion x2, Balance of the Force deluxe expansion, the complete Hoth cycle and Echoes of the Force cycle. Most cards have been played lightly, sleeved in UltraPro sleeves - red _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; black for the Dark Side, blue _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; white for the Light Side. Last five packs of Echoes of the Force are unopened. The main collection is housed in an original core box with insert, and arranged by objective sets with dividers printed from Boardgame Geek. Also included is an UltraPro Satin Tower deck box in black, perfect for taking to a tournament - room for two standard decks in the top and all the fiddly bits (shield, focus _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; damage tokens, plus the Death Star dial and Balance token) fitting in the bottom compartment. The card box with Vader on it is from one of the early game day kits - I actually got it as a prize at the Star Wars Game Experience event at FFG in May of 2013, for coming in dead last in the tournament. :-) There_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s room in there for 4 more standard decks in boxes, plus the oversized Death Star dial from Balance of the Force, plus a little extra room for, well, extras. I keep a few unused sleeves in there. Another extra is a program from the aforementioned Game Experience, with a couple of articles on deckbuilding and other content on X-Wing and the Edge of the Empire RPG. The tuckboxes for the decks were all made by me using scanned art and an online tuckbox generator, back when I actually had time to do such things. Nowadays I can_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t even find the time to play the game, hence the sale. Each box holds a standard 60-card sleeved deck with room for a few extra cards. Included is the unpunched token sheet from the second core set, an additional rule book, and the rule sheets for Edge of Darkness and Balance of the Force.
